properties.address: Bombay Talkies Compound, Himanshu Roy Amarsi Road, Somwari Bazar, Malad West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400064
properties.description: Bombay Talkies was among the largest pre-WW II sound studios in India and introduced some of the major stars and directors of post-independence Hindi cinema (Dev Anand, Raj Kapoor, Ashok Kumar, Dilip Kumar). Founded by Himansu Rai and Devika Rani after their return from Europe in 1934, it was the only major studio established as a full-fledged corporate body with a board of directors that included prominent business leaders of Bombay.

properties.address: 5th Floor, Jewel Building, Maharshi Karve Rd, Opera House, Girgaon, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400004
properties.description: Achhut Kaya premiered at the Roxy Cinema in 1936, boasting a glittering cosmopolitan audience.

properties.address: Raj Kamal Marg, MINT Colony, Parel, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400012
properties.description: Wadia Movietone was established in 1933 by J.B.H. Wadia and Homi Wadia with the help of Parsi mercantile capital. Most of their films were intentionally addressed to the C-grade exhibition sector and tried to recapture J.B.H. Wadiaâ€™s early cinephiliac fascination with Hollywood serials and Westerns.

properties.address: MS Ali Road, Near Express Rest, Grant Road East, Bharat Nagar, Kamathipura, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400007
properties.description: Hunterwali premiered at the Super Cinema in 1935. The film ran to packed houses for more than 25 weeks and became the major money spinner of the year.
